meanings.definition: An act or instance of contesting or disputing
meanings.sent1: The contestations between the two teams led to a heated argument.
meanings.sent2: The legal contestations in court lasted for months.
meanings.sent3: The contestations over who gets the last cookie were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her constant contestations against the rules made her stand out.
meanings.sent5: The contestations in the classroom were so loud that the teacher had to intervene.

meanings.definition: The action of asserting something contrary to what someone else has said
meanings.sent1: His contestations of the facts caused confusion among the group.
meanings.sent2: The political contestations during the debate were intense.
meanings.sent3: Her contestations about being a superhero were quite amusing to her friends.
meanings.sent4: The contestations of the weather forecast proved to be accurate.
meanings.sent5: The contestations of the conspiracy theory were met with skepticism.
